It's obvious something is wrong with the two main parties, even if you just look at the fact that they are not allowing 3rd party candidates to debate with them, or have proper coverage in the media. I believe they are controlled by the same forces behind the scenes. 
 
 I like Michael Peroutka for pres. and Chuck Baldwin for vp are candidates from the Constitution party who are for God, family, nation and restoration of the Constitution. If you get on the mailing list, you will see good things. If you check out their website, there's a section with alot of news articles to read. Too bad we don't have at least 6 more months to prepare for this.
 
 There is so much corruption that has gone on for decades from the 2 main parties, I believe it's time to raise up a 3rd party as a way to offset this. Don't be afraid to vote for a 3rd party candidate. I believe it's time for something new to happen. Here are links for your review. 
 http://www.constitutionparty.org/
 http://www.wevoteprolife.com
 http://www.politics1.com should have just about all candidates in each state
 http://www.http://www.soulwellmall.com/news.html
 for alternative news sources

I would believe that corruption in the two parties was blocking third party's except for one thing - the Reform party of the early 90's. Perot participated in the debates and got a sizable percentage of the vote, and Jesse Ventura won a governorship. They really had their foot in the door. Our voting system is to blame for the two-party system. Not the media. Even if the news gives coverage for Reform, Libertarians, and Greens, it still won't change the fact that the current system encourages parties to merge and agglomerate into blob-parties.
